imdb.title: Tsukuyomi: Moon Phase
imdb.plot: A magazine photographer Kohei Morioka, is on an assignment in Germany. When Kohei enters a dark German castle, he encounters a young vampire girl named Hazuki. Hazuki tried to turn Kohei into her own servant. But Kohei didn't succ...

episodes.title: Onii-sama, Be My Servant
episodes.plot: Due to his insensitivity to spirits, photographer Kouhei Morioka is able to cross a psychic barrier into a long-deserted castle to investigate a girl he sees living there.

episodes.title: Please Call Me Master
episodes.plot: Hazuki's desire to enslave Kouhei centers around her need to break free of the castle confines; but, much to her frustration, he just won't succumb.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, atashi to issho ni kurashite kudasai ne
episodes.plot: Kouhei helps Hazuki seek out her mother, whom she hasn't seen in a few years and who said they'd reunite back in Japan.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, kisu shitakunacchatta
episodes.plot: As another full moon rises, so does Hazuki's thirst for blood. Since Kouhei won't fulfill his role as her slave in this regard, she sets out to find another.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, furufurufurumûn
episodes.plot: Elfriede appears, very determined to return Hazuki to Schwartz Quelle Castle, but Kouhei's role in Hazuki's life presents a problem and a curiosity.

episodes.title: Onii-sama to Kyôto de ufu wakuwaku
episodes.plot: The Midos head for their family home in Kyoto on a mission of mercy. There, a pair of twins betrothed to Seiji and Kouhei take an intense dislike to Hazuki.

episodes.title: ...Datte hoshikatta da mon
episodes.plot: Elfriede declares herself a rival of Hazuki for Kouhei's affections. Kouhei challenges Hazuki not to use her special powers on people.

episodes.title: Okaa-sama da kitekureta! Ureshii
episodes.plot: Count von Kinkel comes to Japan to take back Hazuki himself, leaving Elfreida and what remains of Vigo to handle Grandpa Ryuuhei and Kouhei.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, atashi wo yume kara tasukete... onegai
episodes.plot: As Grandpa Ryuuhei and Elfriede deal with Heinrich von Kinkel, Hazuki is kept locked in a dream state which Kouhei attempts to break.

episodes.title: Yurusanai... hajimete no shimobe no kuse ni
episodes.plot: As Kouhei lies dying in the hospital, Hazuki, home alone, communes with her inner thoughts, but not all the thoughts in her head turn out to be hers.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, ansei ni shitenakya dame
episodes.plot: Recovering at home, Kouhei finds himself mediating between three ornery girls who want to tear each other's hair out as well as nurse him mercilessly.

episodes.title: Yurusenai no, aitsu dake wa!
episodes.plot: The count kidnaps Grandpa Ryuuhei to force the others into a confrontation where he tricks them into fighting one another. His mastery of light and illusion isn't his only weapon, as Kouhei finds out to his detriment.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, minna de hakushaku wo taoshimashô ne
episodes.plot: Kouhei, Ryuuhei, Seiji, Hazuki and Elfriede ready for what they hope will be their final battle with the count.

episodes.title: Onii-sama to issho ni... osanpo shitai desu
episodes.plot: Guilt over the outcome of battling the Count puts Hazuki in touch with Luna, leaving her a blended personality.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, 'sekinin' totte kudasai ne
episodes.plot: Full moon: time to feed. With Hazuki taking Kouhei's disdainful words to heart, Luna merges closer with Hazuki.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, dôshitemo furufurudô nekomimi manjû ja nakucha dame nan desu
episodes.plot: Hazuki's capacity for prolonged stillness inspires Kouhei to conduct an effective photo shoot.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, nande konna koto ni naruwake!?
episodes.plot: To protect Hazuki further, Kouhei asks to be trained as a psychic fighter like the rest of his family, but Grandpa Ryuuhei strongly objects.

episodes.title: Yahho! Haihô! Ima, ai ni yukimasu ne
episodes.plot: Eight months after the fire, Kouhei's developing abilities are tested at Yayoi's dojo.

episodes.title: Oyma no hi yukemuri no saru neko ni hige... de, antatachi dare?
episodes.plot: As everyone visits Kouhei for Hazuki's once-a-month visit and feeding, Yayoi has a scuffle with the first of three servants from the Master.

episodes.title: Ojii-sama, dôshite sonna kakkô shiteru n desu ka?
episodes.plot: Vampire foes finally invade the mountain retreat - a bad time for Kouhei, laid low with broken bones.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, sorette doko no chihô no temari uta?
episodes.plot: Having drunk Kouhei's blood, Arte becomes self-actualized and wants Kouhei for herself.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, sonna hito datta n desu ka!?
episodes.plot: It's time Kouhei was let in on a family secret about himself.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, watashi tte sonna ni hen desu ka?
episodes.plot: Hearing about the Jagan, Jeda attacks. Hazuki must sip from Kouhei to join the fight at full strength, but he's become terrified of her.

episodes.title: Sayonara, Onii-sama... watashi, hontô ni kaecchau yo?
episodes.plot: To save her friends, Hazuki sadly agrees to return to the Master's castle, but her friends actively object, renewing the fight.

episodes.title: Onii-sama, saishûkai dasô desu yo! Zutto watashi no shimobe de ite kudasai ne?
episodes.plot: The big battle's been won but there's a full moon out, and every vampire near Kouhei wants a sip.

episodes.title: Onii-Sama, Wavering Wavering Sparkling Sparkiling Drifting. What's This?
episodes.plot: What do you do for your 26th episode when your 25-episode story is done? Go spoof yourself.
